text: During the transformation of matter from the solid to the liquid state, the heat supplied does not produce temperature increase because

text: In a slide wire bridge, the balance is obtained at a point 25cm from one end of wire 1m long. The resistance to be tested is connected to that end and a standard resistance of 3.6\(\Omega\) is connected to the other end of the wire. Determine the value of the unknown resistance

3R = 3.6
R = 1.2\(\Omega\)

I. It is applicable when energy is radiated as electrons are revolving

text: The distance between an object and its real image in a convex lens is 40cm. If the magnification of the image is 3, calculate the focal length of the lens
explanation:
u + v = 40
\(\frac{v}{u}\) = 3
v = 3u
u + 3u = 40
4u = 40
u = 10cm
v = 3u = 30cm
f = \(\frac{uv}{u + v} = \frac{10(30)}{10 + 30} = \frac{300}{40}\)
= 7.5 cm
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A ray of light passes through the centre of curvature of a concave mirror and strikes the mirror. At what angle is the ray reflected?

text: The pitch of a screw jack is 0.45cm and the arm is 60cm long. If the efficiency of the Jack is 75/π %, calculate the mechanical advantage.

text: A supply of 400V is connected across capacitors of 3μf and 6μf in series. Calculate the charge
explanation:
C\(_T\) = \(\frac{C_1 \times C_2}{C_1 + C_2}\)
= \(\frac{3 \times 6}{3 + 6}\)= \(\frac{18}{9}\) = 2μfQ = CV⇒ 2 × 10\(^{-6}\) × 400⇒ 800 × 10\(^{-6}\)C = 8 × 10\(^{-4}\)C

text: A vibrator causes water ripples to travel across the surface of a tank. The wave travels 50cm in 2s and the distance between successive crests is 5cm. Calculate the frequency of the vibrator
explanation:
\(V = \frac{Distance}{time}\)
= \(\frac{50cm}{2s}\)
= 25 cms\(^{-1}\).
\(V = f \lambda\)
\(f = \frac{V}{\lambda}\)
\(f = \frac{25}{5}\)
= 5 Hz

text: A thermocouple thermometer is connected to a millivoltmeter which can read up to 10mV. When one junction is in ice at 0°C and the other is steam at 100°C, the millivoltmeter reads 4mV. What is the maximum temperature which this arrangement can measure

t\(_\theta\) - t\(_o\) = 10,t\(_{100}\) - t\(_o\) = 4
θ=t\(_\theta\) - t\(_o\)t\(_{100}\) - t\(_o\)×100
104×100=250°C

from rest

text: The length of the seconds hand of laboratory clock is 0.1m. Calculate the speed at the top of the seconds hand
explanation:
\(\text{Circumference} \, (d) = 2 \pi r = 2 \pi (0.1) \approx 0.6283 \, \text{m}\)
\(\text{Time for one revolution} \, (t) = 60 \, \text{s}\)
\(\text{Speed} \, (v) = \frac{d}{t} = \frac{0.6283}{60} \approx 0.01047 \, \text{m/s} \approx 1.05 \times 10^{-2} \, \text{ms}^{-1}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Workdone on an object to bring it to a certain point in space is called
explanation:
Gravitational potential energy is the energy an object possesses because of its position in a gravitational field. Since the force required to lift it is equal to its weight, it follows that the gravitational potential energy is equal to its weight times the height to which it is lifted. (i.e, P.E\(_g\) = ωh, where ω = mg)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A copper rod, 5m long, when heated through 10ºC, expands by 1mm. If a second copper rod, 2.5m long, is heated through 5ºC, by how much will it expand?
explanation:
For the first copper rod:\(L_0 = 5 \, \text{m} = 5000 \, \text{mm}, \quad \Delta T = 10 \, \text{°C}, \quad \Delta L = 1 \, \text{mm}\)Coefficient of linear expansion \( \alpha \):\(\alpha = \frac{1 \, \text{mm}}{5000 \, \text{mm} \cdot 10} = \frac{1}{50000} \, \text{mm}^{-1}\)
For the second copper rod:\(L_0 = 2.5 \, \text{m} = 2500 \, \text{mm}, \quad \Delta T = 5 \, \text{°C}\)Expansion:\(\Delta L = L_0 \cdot \alpha \cdot \Delta T = 2500 \, \text{mm} \cdot \frac{1}{50000} \, \text{mm}^{-1} \cdot 5 = 0.25 \, \text{mm}\)
The second copper rod will expand by: \(0.25 \, \text{mm}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A safety precaution designed to prolong the life of a lead acid accumulator is

options.A: By topping up the cells with concentrated acid
options.B: The use of naked flame when charging the battery
options.C: Keeping the specific gravity of the electrolyte within specified range
options.D: By connecting wires to the terminals directly when testing the level of charging

explanation:

text:

I. vibration produces waves
II. waves transmit energy along the medium

text: A rectangular solid block has length 10cm, breadth 5cm and height 2cm. If it lies on a horizontal surface, and has density 100kg/m\(^3\), calculate the pressure it exerts on the surface.
explanation:

P = 100 × 2 × 10\(^{-2}\) × 10 = 20 N/m\(^2\)

text: An object is acted upon by a system of parallel forces causing the object to be in state equilibrium. Which of the following statement is not correct

text:
Which of the following statements is/are correct for a freely falling body?
I. the total is entirely kinetic
II. the ratio of potential energy to kinetic energy is constant
III. the sum of potential and kinetic energy is constant
explanation:
- the total energy at any point is a combination of the P.E and K.E- the sum of PE and KE at any point is always constant not the ratio of P.E to K.E
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Efficiency of conduction in liquids and gases compared to solids is
explanation:
Efficiency of conduction in liquids and gases compared to solids is less efficient than solid.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A well 1km deep is filled with a liquid of density 950kg/m\(^3\) and g = 10m/s\(^2\), the pressure at the bottom of the well is
"Sum of all forces acting on a body is zero." This condition represents equilibrium'
explanation:
First condition
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following bodies, each with centre of gravity G, lying on a horizontal table, is/are in unstable equilibrium?
explanation:
- I & II are in neutral equilibrium. They will roll continuously on the table- III is a body with high centre of gravity (unstable)- IV is a body with high centre of gravity (stable)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The volume of a stone having an irregular shape can be determined using?
explanation:
The volume of object is the same as the volume of liquid displaced in a container such as measuring cylinder.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In Sunlight, a blue flower looks blue because we see the flower by the light it
explanation:
Colours presented by objects are the ones reflected
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A body moves in SHM between two point 20m on the straight line Joining the points. If the angular speed of the body is 5 rad/s. Calculate its speed when it is 6m from the center of the motion.
explanation:
From two parts 20m aparta = 10m, x = 6m, A = 5V = ω\(\sqrt{A^2 - X^2}\)  = 5\(\sqrt{10^2 - 6^2}\) = 40m/s
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The diagram shows a uniform meter rule AB which balances horizontally at the 90cm mark when a mass of 0.2kg is suspended from B. Calculate the mass of the meter rule.
explanation:
M\(_r\)(90 - 50) = 0.2(100 - 90)40M\(_r\) = 0.2 × 10
M\(_r\)=240=0.05kg
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The equilibrium position of objects in any field corresponds to situation of
explanation:
Potential energy = mgh = (mg)h = force × distance⇒ 0 × d = 0
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
The height at which the atmosphere ceases to exist is about 80km. If the atmospheric pressure on the ground level is 760mmHg, the pressure at a height of 20km above the ground level is
(ρm = 13.6g/cm\(^3\) ρ = 0.00013g/cm\(^3\) )
A cone is in unstable equilibrium, has its potential energy
explanation:
In unstable equilibrium, when the cone is disturbed, it tends to fall further from its equilibrium position, leading to a decrease in height and thus an increase in potential energy.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A mass of 0.5kg is whirled in a vertical circle of radius 2m at a steady rate of 2 rev/s. Calculate the centripetal force
explanation:
ω = 2πF = 2π × 2 = 4πrad\(^{-1}\)Centripetal force = mrω\(^2\)⇒ 0.5 × 2 × (4π)\(^2\)⇒ 157.75N
Approximately = 158N.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A body was slightly displaced from its equilibrium position. Which one of the following is a condition for its stable equilibrium

options.A: an increase in the kinetic energy of the body
options.B: an increase in the potential energy of the body
options.C: a decrease in the kinetic energy of the body
options.D: an increase in the height of the body

explanation:
Stable equilibrium brings about increase in potential energy as the height rises after displacement.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following readings cannot be determined with a meter rule?
explanation:
Meter rule has a reading accuracy of 0.5mm or 0.05cm, thus measurement is M ± 0.05cm i.e 2.00, 2.05, 2.50, 2.55 etc.The reading that cannot be read is 2.56cm.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following is consistent with Charles' law?
explanation:
This is the correct graph. The graph is volume against temperature where temperature is in Celsius.
